title: About
text: This is the project website for ISSS608-VAA Group 7.

title: ISSS608-VAA-Project
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications. In this website, you will find the project materials for this course.

title: Project Proposal
text:
According to a research paper [1] which utilises information from the 2015 Nigeria National Water and Sanitation Survey, more than 38 percent of all improved water points in Nigeria are non-functional. Hence, it would be in the interest of the Nigerian government as well as non-governmental organizations and researchers to discover waterpoints patterns in Nigeria and potentially figure out what is causing the problem and how to solve it.
The scope of this project is to reveal and understand the spread and geospatial patterns of functional and non-functional waterpoints in Nigeria. This will help reduce the difficulty of users such as the government, local community planners and academic researchers in visualising waterpoint patterns in Nigeria. The aim is to make the data more accessible and easier to interpret by having interactive charts showing both high level patterns and low level details such as water access by district.

title: Project Proposal
text:
a) Overview
The first tab shows an overview revealing high level patterns. It can display locations of functional, non-functional and unknown water points in term of country level or regional level throughout Nigeria. The intention is to help the users visualize which region in the country has higher functioning/non-functioning water points at a glance. There will be a few filtering options for the users such as water points status, technology deployed in water points and performance of water points.

title: Project Proposal
text:
b) Visual Analysis
Figma Image
The second tab applies visual analytics techniques to the dataset. We make use of analytics approach for knowledge discovery, statistical testing as well as visualising uncertainty. Graphs include correlation matrices, errors bars, confidence strips, ridge plot and funnel plot.
This will help users identify relationships or correlations between difference features such as technology used or pressure score with number of non-functional water points through correlation matrices. It may also allow users to compare statistics across different districts through oneway ANOVA tests visualizations.
